image.altText: A portrait photo of acclaimed American theatre director Peter Sellars.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Festival is launching its line-up for its 2026 instalment, and the program will feature both fresh and returning faces, including British rock band Pulp, French actor Isabelle Huppert and American theatre director Peter Sellars.

title.children: Peter Sellars plots return to Adelaide Festival 24 years after controversy

image.altText: A church with a tall, narrow steeple under a bright blue sky with clouds. There are trees and green grass in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The tallest church in Mount Gambier will be sold so the congregation and its pastor can focus on their Christian mission rather than paying to repair its 154-year-old building's rickety steeple.

title.children: Heritage-listed church to be sold to avoid steeple repair cost

image.altText: The scene of a crash between a car and a Stobie pole.

props.synopsis: An allegedly unlicensed driver will face court after he crashed into a Stobie pole at Minlaton on SA's Yorke Peninsula, cutting the power supply to surrounding areas, police say.

title.children: Hundreds left without electricity when car hit power pole

image.altText: Man stands overlooking lake on platform

props.synopsis: Hard-working and charismatic former politician Troy Bell was so well liked, he was twice re-elected while awaiting trial for stealing public money. Now, he joins a short list of former SA politicians who have served time for crime.

title.children: Troy Bell joins list of jailed ex-MPs after abusing position of 'authority and trust'

image.altText: A silhouette figure of a scuba diver descends into darkness as a stream of bubbles rise into the light,

props.synopsis: A new documentary by director Jennifer Peedom delves deep into the attraction of cave diving, and why Richard Harris says risk-taking is crucial for resilience.

title.children: Why Thai cave rescuer Richard Harris can't quit diving

image.altText: A composite image of women's faces

props.synopsis: Meet the national finalists in the running for the 2025 AgriFutures Rural Women's Award celebrating change-makers in rural, regional and remote Australia.

title.children: Entrepreneurs and innovators vie for 2025 Rural Women's Award

image.altText: a person sits in the drivers seat of a car with a tv screen in front of them

props.synopsis: More than 20 regional NDIS clients have gone on to get their L-plates since completing a course with a unique driving simulator.

title.children: Kaitie was always told they would never drive. This new tech changed that

image.altText: Small and medium rise buildings on the edge of a city

props.synopsis: A scheme to increase housing supply by boosting confidence in apartment construction projects in Adelaide's CBD has been unveiled by the SA government as a major election commitment — but the opposition has questioned the affordability of the proposal.

title.children: Scheme to boost CBD apartments unveiled as SA election commitment

image.altText: A stage at the Harvest Rock music festival in Adelaide's eastern parklands amid stormy weather.

props.synopsis: A burst of stormy weather causes interruptions at Adelaide's Harvest Rock music event and the OzAsia Festival, amid more downpours in other parts of the state.

title.children: Storms disrupt Adelaide's  Harvest Rock and OzAsia festivals

image.altText: Fox standing in green grass.

props.synopsis: A nationwide program has traced how foxes spread from south-eastern Australia to as far away as the Pilbara in just 70 years, as part of efforts to revive native species populations decimated by the pest.

title.children: How foxes 'colonised' Australia in 70 years

image.altText: Overhead image of Glenelg's ferris wheel and palm trees and the roadworks

props.synopsis: Business owners along one of Adelaide's most renowned beachside retail and dining strips are making tough decisions to shut up shop as they fight to survive a perfect storm of downturn.

title.children: Beachside business owners struggle as trade wiped out by roadworks

image.altText: Image of soldier in historic uniform with words from letter in background

props.synopsis: A century-old message in a bottle from a World War I soldier to his mother has been found on a beach in Western Australia's south.

title.children: WWI soldier's message in a bottle found on WA beach

image.altText: Geoff looney bird watching

props.synopsis: For 50 years Geoff Looney has called the remote Indigenous community of Menindee in Far West New South Wales home. Thirty years ago he started recording information about birdlife in the region which has grown to more than 209 species recorded.

title.children: The 'Birdman' of Menindee Lakes has recorded more than 200 species

image.altText: A person holds a fishing rod. There is blue ocean in the background

props.synopsis: Catch limits for recreational fishers will be reduced amid 'severe decline' in fish species due to the algal bloom.

title.children: Recreational fishers say new restrictions are unfairly targeted

image.altText: A sealed road with yellow and brown scrub flanking it. There is blue sky and gum trees in the background.

props.synopsis: The federal government is seeking feedback on a proposal to reduce the default speed limit of 100 kilometres an hour on unsigned roads outside of built-up areas.

title.children: Lower speed limit plan to tackle alarming death toll on unsigned rural roads

image.altText: Esther looks sadly out her bedroom window.

props.synopsis: They started high school as the world went into lockdown, interrupting their young lives at a pivotal moment. Now they’re graduating year 12 and figuring out what to do next.

title.children: 'Lost that side of myself': Generation pandemic set to face Year 12 exams

image.altText: A mother sits on the couch smiling with her two twins on her knees

props.synopsis: The international surrogacy market attracts hundreds of Australians each year, but one country in particular has become a top destination for people wishing to start their families.

title.children: Hundreds of Australians are heading to Russia's doorstep to have babies

image.altText: Two men wearing suits walk next to each other on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese touch down in the Malaysian capital of Kuala Lumpur ahead of the annual summit of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN).

title.children: Trump and Albanese arrive in Malaysia ahead of ASEAN summit

image.altText: Two men in suits walking.

props.synopsis: The prime minister batted away concerns over Kevin Rudd's future after Donald Trump said he does not forget when people "say bad" things about him.

title.children: Albanese dismisses lingering questions about Trump and Rudd

image.altText: A little girl on the beach wearing a cap and pink top

props.synopsis: The family of a 22-month-old girl who died at a Northern Territory child care centre last year are calling on the government to ban the type of fencing that caused her death under the banner of "Ebony's Law".

title.children: Toddler's family call for 'Ebony's Law' after childcare centre death

image.altText: A man in a crowd reaches out his hands.

props.synopsis: If Zohran Mamdani wins, he will become New York's first Muslim and millennial mayor. It's something his campaign has been acutely aware of as he taps into new voting bases.

title.children: 'Zohranastrians' have taken over NYC. It could be the city's turning point

image.altText: Min Aung Hlaing

props.synopsis: Instead of talking about Myanmar, the US president and his regional counterparts will be congratulating themselves for helping Thailand and Cambodia strike a peace deal.

title.children: 'Lack of unity': Myanmar haunts ASEAN summit

image.altText: Former U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris speaks during a gala in San Francisco

props.synopsis: The former US vice-president won't commit to making another bid for the White House yet, but reiterates she's "not done" with public service.

title.children: Kamala Harris hints she may run for US presidency again

image.altText: A man wearing a mask and holding a stick stands over a woman lying on the ground.

props.synopsis: Settler violence against Palestinians in the West Bank ramps up every year during olive harvest, but a brazen attack caught on camera has left the community shaken.

title.children: West Bank community left reeling after Palestinian clubbed by masked Israeli settler

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in a blue suit and white shirt speaking to someone out of frame.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he plans to hike tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10 per cent because of an anti-tariff television ad aired by the province of Ontario.

title.children: Trump punishes Canada with 10pc tariff increase over TV ad stoush

image.altText: A man holding two letters in front of a post box

props.synopsis: From feeling "harassed" to fraudulent activity, this is what you had to say about how receiving mail that is not yours has impacted your life.

title.children: Readers share their experiences of receiving other people's mail

image.altText: Smart bot sex dolls Chinese factory

props.synopsis: Child sexual abuse doll heads are being sold on Temu as hairdressing model mannequins to harness a legal loophole, according to experts who say it is part of an "unhealthy culture".

title.children: Child sex dolls sold without heads to harness loophole

image.altText: Australia women's cricket shirt

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia says two members of the Australian Women's World Cup cricket team have been "touched inappropriately" in India.

title.children: Australian women's cricket players 'touched inappropriately' in India

image.altText: Close up of bananas.

props.synopsis: Australia's first genetically modified banana has been tweaked to protect it from a disease that's on the verge of wiping out crops around the world. Researchers hope it may be on our shelves by 2027.

title.children: Could an Australian banana prevent a global crop collapse?

image.altText: GettyImages-1308071351

props.synopsis: Two years after she took out a domestic violence order against her ex-partner, Aurora realised he was working 10m from her reserved seat at the Gabba — she believes he accessed her details by calling the club’s membership line.

title.children: Two phone calls confirm footy fan's suspicion about how ex tracked her down

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: We both know you're hoping for the best with this week's quiz. Just remember, hope will get you nowhere.

title.children: Convinced your losing streak is finally over? Prove it. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: illustration of a faceless woman, looking back with a bouquet. around her logos of social media platforms, smartphones in fists

props.synopsis: Gen Zs in several Asian countries launch an online war against political "nepo babies" who flaunt their wealth on social media.

title.children: In some countries 'wealth flaunting' was aspirational. Now gen Z are calling it out

image.altText: Oscar Piastri in the F1 garage, looking over his shoulder

props.synopsis: Britain's Lando Norris has dominated qualifying in Mexico to take pole position for Monday morning's grand prix, putting championship leader Oscar Piastri under pressure.

title.children: Piastri's F1 championship lead in danger after qualifying in Mexico

image.altText: An older woman pats a Lassie dog

props.synopsis: Lockhart died on Thursday of natural causes at her home in Santa Monica, a family spokesperson says.

title.children: June Lockhart, beloved mother figure from Lassie and Lost In Space, dies aged 100
